005package edu.wpi.first.math.estimator;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Matrix;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.Nat;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.Num;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.Pair;
011import edu.wpi.first.math.StateSpaceUtil;
012import edu.wpi.first.math.numbers.N1;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.system.Discretization;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.system.NumericalIntegration;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.system.NumericalJacobian;
016import java.util.function.BiFunction;
017import org.ejml.simple.SimpleMatrix;
018
019/**
020 * A Kalman filter combines predictions from a model and measurements to give an estimate of the
021 * true ystem state. This is useful because many states cannot be measured directly as a result of
022 * sensor noise, or because the state is "hidden".
023 *
024 * <p>The Unscented Kalman filter is similar to the {@link KalmanFilter Kalman filter}, except that
025 * it propagates carefully chosen points called sigma points through the non-linear model to obtain
026 * an estimate of the true covariance (as opposed to a linearized version of it). This means that
027 * the UKF works with nonlinear systems.
028 */
029@SuppressWarnings({"MemberName", "ClassTypeParameterName"})
030public class UnscentedKalmanFilter<States extends Num, Inputs extends Num, Outputs extends Num>
031    implements KalmanTypeFilter<States, Inputs, Outputs> {
032  private final Nat<States> m_states;
033  private final Nat<Outputs> m_outputs;
034
035  private final BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_f;
036  private final BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> m_h;
037
038  private BiFunction<Matrix<States, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_meanFuncX;
039  private BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> m_meanFuncY;
040  private BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_residualFuncX;
041  private BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> m_residualFuncY;
042  private BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> m_addFuncX;
043
044  private Matrix<States, N1> m_xHat;
045  private Matrix<States, States> m_P;
046  private final Matrix<States, States> m_contQ;
047  private final Matrix<Outputs, Outputs> m_contR;
048  private Matrix<States, ?> m_sigmasF;
049  private double m_dtSeconds;
050
051  private final MerweScaledSigmaPoints<States> m_pts;
052
053  /**
054   * Constructs an Unscented Kalman Filter.
055   *
056   * @param states A Nat representing the number of states.
057   * @param outputs A Nat representing the number of outputs.
058   * @param f A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the derivative of the state vector.
059   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
060   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of model states.
061   * @param measurementStdDevs Standard deviations of measurements.
062   * @param nominalDtSeconds Nominal discretization timestep.
063   */
064  @SuppressWarnings("LambdaParameterName")
065  public UnscentedKalmanFilter(
066      Nat<States> states,
067      Nat<Outputs> outputs,
068      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> f,
069      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> h,
070      Matrix<States, N1> stateStdDevs,
071      Matrix<Outputs, N1> measurementStdDevs,
072      double nominalDtSeconds) {
073    this(
074        states,
075        outputs,
076        f,
077        h,
078        stateStdDevs,
079        measurementStdDevs,
080        (sigmas, Wm) -> sigmas.times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(Wm)),
081        (sigmas, Wm) -> sigmas.times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(Wm)),
082        Matrix::minus,
083        Matrix::minus,
084        Matrix::plus,
085        nominalDtSeconds);
086  }
087
088  /**
089   * Constructs an unscented Kalman filter with custom mean, residual, and addition functions. Using
090   * custom functions for arithmetic can be useful if you have angles in the state or measurements,
091   * because they allow you to correctly account for the modular nature of angle arithmetic.
092   *
093   * @param states A Nat representing the number of states.
094   * @param outputs A Nat representing the number of outputs.
095   * @param f A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the derivative of the state vector.
096   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
097   * @param stateStdDevs Standard deviations of model states.
098   * @param measurementStdDevs Standard deviations of measurements.
099   * @param meanFuncX A function that computes the mean of 2 * States + 1 state vectors using a
100   *     given set of weights.
101   * @param meanFuncY A function that computes the mean of 2 * States + 1 measurement vectors using
102   *     a given set of weights.
103   * @param residualFuncX A function that computes the residual of two state vectors (i.e. it
104   *     subtracts them.)
105   * @param residualFuncY A function that computes the residual of two measurement vectors (i.e. it
106   *     subtracts them.)
107   * @param addFuncX A function that adds two state vectors.
108   * @param nominalDtSeconds Nominal discretization timestep.
109   */
110  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
111  public UnscentedKalmanFilter(
112      Nat<States> states,
113      Nat<Outputs> outputs,
114      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> f,
115      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> h,
116      Matrix<States, N1> stateStdDevs,
117      Matrix<Outputs, N1> measurementStdDevs,
118      BiFunction<Matrix<States, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> meanFuncX,
119      BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> meanFuncY,
120      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> residualFuncX,
121      BiFunction<Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>, Matrix<Outputs, N1>> residualFuncY,
122      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> addFuncX,
123      double nominalDtSeconds) {
124    this.m_states = states;
125    this.m_outputs = outputs;
126
127    m_f = f;
128    m_h = h;
129
130    m_meanFuncX = meanFuncX;
131    m_meanFuncY = meanFuncY;
132    m_residualFuncX = residualFuncX;
133    m_residualFuncY = residualFuncY;
134    m_addFuncX = addFuncX;
135
136    m_dtSeconds = nominalDtSeconds;
137
138    m_contQ = StateSpaceUtil.makeCovarianceMatrix(states, stateStdDevs);
139    m_contR = StateSpaceUtil.makeCovarianceMatrix(outputs, measurementStdDevs);
140
141    m_pts = new MerweScaledSigmaPoints<>(states);
142
143    reset();
144  }
145
146  @SuppressWarnings({"ParameterName", "LocalVariableName"})
147  static <S extends Num, C extends Num> Pair<Matrix<C, N1>, Matrix<C, C>> unscentedTransform(
148      Nat<S> s,
149      Nat<C> dim,
150      Matrix<C, ?> sigmas,
151      Matrix<?, N1> Wm,
152      Matrix<?, N1> Wc,
153      BiFunction<Matrix<C, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<C, N1>> meanFunc,
154      BiFunction<Matrix<C, N1>, Matrix<C, N1>, Matrix<C, N1>> residualFunc) {
155    if (sigmas.getNumRows() != dim.getNum() || sigmas.getNumCols() != 2 * s.getNum() + 1) {
156      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
157          "Sigmas must be covDim by 2 * states + 1! Got "
158              + sigmas.getNumRows()
159              + " by "
160              + sigmas.getNumCols());
161    }
162
163    if (Wm.getNumRows() != 2 * s.getNum() + 1 || Wm.getNumCols() != 1) {
164      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
165          "Wm must be 2 * states + 1 by 1! Got " + Wm.getNumRows() + " by " + Wm.getNumCols());
166    }
167
168    if (Wc.getNumRows() != 2 * s.getNum() + 1 || Wc.getNumCols() != 1) {
169      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
170          "Wc must be 2 * states + 1 by 1! Got " + Wc.getNumRows() + " by " + Wc.getNumCols());
171    }
172
173    // New mean is usually just the sum of the sigmas * weight:
174    //       n
175    // dot = Σ W[k] Xᵢ[k]
176    //      k=1
177    Matrix<C, N1> x = meanFunc.apply(sigmas, Wm);
178
179    // New covariance is the sum of the outer product of the residuals times the
180    // weights
181    Matrix<C, ?> y = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(dim.getNum(), 2 * s.getNum() + 1));
182    for (int i = 0; i < 2 * s.getNum() + 1; i++) {
183      // y[:, i] = sigmas[:, i] - x
184      y.setColumn(i, residualFunc.apply(sigmas.extractColumnVector(i), x));
185    }
186    Matrix<C, C> P =
187        y.times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(Wc.diag()))
188            .times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(y.transpose()));
189
190    return new Pair<>(x, P);
191  }
192
193  /**
194   * Returns the error covariance matrix P.
195   *
196   * @return the error covariance matrix P.
197   */
198  @Override
199  public Matrix<States, States> getP() {
200    return m_P;
201  }
202
203  /**
204   * Returns an element of the error covariance matrix P.
205   *
206   * @param row Row of P.
207   * @param col Column of P.
208   * @return the value of the error covariance matrix P at (i, j).
209   */
210  @Override
211  public double getP(int row, int col) {
212    return m_P.get(row, col);
213  }
214
215  /**
216   * Sets the entire error covariance matrix P.
217   *
218   * @param newP The new value of P to use.
219   */
220  @Override
221  public void setP(Matrix<States, States> newP) {
222    m_P = newP;
223  }
224
225  /**
226   * Returns the state estimate x-hat.
227   *
228   * @return the state estimate x-hat.
229   */
230  @Override
231  public Matrix<States, N1> getXhat() {
232    return m_xHat;
233  }
234
235  /**
236   * Returns an element of the state estimate x-hat.
237   *
238   * @param row Row of x-hat.
239   * @return the value of the state estimate x-hat at i.
240   */
241  @Override
242  public double getXhat(int row) {
243    return m_xHat.get(row, 0);
244  }
245
246  /**
247   * Set initial state estimate x-hat.
248   *
249   * @param xHat The state estimate x-hat.
250   */
251  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
252  @Override
253  public void setXhat(Matrix<States, N1> xHat) {
254    m_xHat = xHat;
255  }
256
257  /**
258   * Set an element of the initial state estimate x-hat.
259   *
260   * @param row Row of x-hat.
261   * @param value Value for element of x-hat.
262   */
263  @Override
264  public void setXhat(int row, double value) {
265    m_xHat.set(row, 0, value);
266  }
267
268  /** Resets the observer. */
269  @Override
270  public void reset() {
271    m_xHat = new Matrix<>(m_states, Nat.N1());
272    m_P = new Matrix<>(m_states, m_states);
273    m_sigmasF = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(m_states.getNum(), 2 * m_states.getNum() + 1));
274  }
275
276  /**
277   * Project the model into the future with a new control input u.
278   *
279   * @param u New control input from controller.
280   * @param dtSeconds Timestep for prediction.
281   */
282  @SuppressWarnings({"LocalVariableName", "ParameterName"})
283  @Override
284  public void predict(Matrix<Inputs, N1> u, double dtSeconds) {
285    // Discretize Q before projecting mean and covariance forward
286    Matrix<States, States> contA =
287        NumericalJacobian.numericalJacobianX(m_states, m_states, m_f, m_xHat, u);
288    var discQ = Discretization.discretizeAQTaylor(contA, m_contQ, dtSeconds).getSecond();
289
290    var sigmas = m_pts.sigmaPoints(m_xHat, m_P);
291
292    for (int i = 0; i < m_pts.getNumSigmas(); ++i) {
293      Matrix<States, N1> x = sigmas.extractColumnVector(i);
294
295      m_sigmasF.setColumn(i, NumericalIntegration.rk4(m_f, x, u, dtSeconds));
296    }
297
298    var ret =
299        unscentedTransform(
300            m_states,
301            m_states,
302            m_sigmasF,
303            m_pts.getWm(),
304            m_pts.getWc(),
305            m_meanFuncX,
306            m_residualFuncX);
307
308    m_xHat = ret.getFirst();
309    m_P = ret.getSecond().plus(discQ);
310    m_dtSeconds = dtSeconds;
311  }
312
313  /**
314   * Correct the state estimate x-hat using the measurements in y.
315   *
316   * @param u Same control input used in the predict step.
317   * @param y Measurement vector.
318   */
319  @SuppressWarnings("ParameterName")
320  @Override
321  public void correct(Matrix<Inputs, N1> u, Matrix<Outputs, N1> y) {
322    correct(
323        m_outputs, u, y, m_h, m_contR, m_meanFuncY, m_residualFuncY, m_residualFuncX, m_addFuncX);
324  }
325
326  /**
327   * Correct the state estimate x-hat using the measurements in y.
328   *
329   * <p>This is useful for when the measurements available during a timestep's Correct() call vary.
330   * The h(x, u) passed to the constructor is used if one is not provided (the two-argument version
331   * of this function).
332   *
333   * @param <R> Number of measurements in y.
334   * @param rows Number of rows in y.
335   * @param u Same control input used in the predict step.
336   * @param y Measurement vector.
337   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
338   * @param R Measurement noise covariance matrix (continuous-time).
339   */
340  @SuppressWarnings({"ParameterName", "LambdaParameterName", "LocalVariableName"})
341  public <R extends Num> void correct(
342      Nat<R> rows,
343      Matrix<Inputs, N1> u,
344      Matrix<R, N1> y,
345      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> h,
346      Matrix<R, R> R) {
347    BiFunction<Matrix<R, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> meanFuncY =
348        (sigmas, Wm) -> sigmas.times(Matrix.changeBoundsUnchecked(Wm));
349    BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> residualFuncX =
350        Matrix::minus;
351    BiFunction<Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> residualFuncY = Matrix::minus;
352    BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> addFuncX = Matrix::plus;
353    correct(rows, u, y, h, R, meanFuncY, residualFuncY, residualFuncX, addFuncX);
354  }
355
356  /**
357   * Correct the state estimate x-hat using the measurements in y.
358   *
359   * <p>This is useful for when the measurements available during a timestep's Correct() call vary.
360   * The h(x, u) passed to the constructor is used if one is not provided (the two-argument version
361   * of this function).
362   *
363   * @param <R> Number of measurements in y.
364   * @param rows Number of rows in y.
365   * @param u Same control input used in the predict step.
366   * @param y Measurement vector.
367   * @param h A vector-valued function of x and u that returns the measurement vector.
368   * @param R Measurement noise covariance matrix (continuous-time).
369   * @param meanFuncY A function that computes the mean of 2 * States + 1 measurement vectors using
370   *     a given set of weights.
371   * @param residualFuncY A function that computes the residual of two measurement vectors (i.e. it
372   *     subtracts them.)
373   * @param residualFuncX A function that computes the residual of two state vectors (i.e. it
374   *     subtracts them.)
375   * @param addFuncX A function that adds two state vectors.
376   */
377  @SuppressWarnings({"ParameterName", "LocalVariableName"})
378  public <R extends Num> void correct(
379      Nat<R> rows,
380      Matrix<Inputs, N1> u,
381      Matrix<R, N1> y,
382      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<Inputs, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> h,
383      Matrix<R, R> R,
384      BiFunction<Matrix<R, ?>, Matrix<?, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> meanFuncY,
385      BiFunction<Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>, Matrix<R, N1>> residualFuncY,
386      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> residualFuncX,
387      BiFunction<Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>, Matrix<States, N1>> addFuncX) {
388    final var discR = Discretization.discretizeR(R, m_dtSeconds);
389
390    // Transform sigma points into measurement space
391    Matrix<R, ?> sigmasH = new Matrix<>(new SimpleMatrix(rows.getNum(), 2 * m_states.getNum() + 1));
392    var sigmas = m_pts.sigmaPoints(m_xHat, m_P);
393    for (int i = 0; i < m_pts.getNumSigmas(); i++) {
394      Matrix<R, N1> hRet = h.apply(sigmas.extractColumnVector(i), u);
395      sigmasH.setColumn(i, hRet);
396    }
397
398    // Mean and covariance of prediction passed through unscented transform
399    var transRet =
400        unscentedTransform(
401            m_states, rows, sigmasH, m_pts.getWm(), m_pts.getWc(), meanFuncY, residualFuncY);
402    var yHat = transRet.getFirst();
403    var Py = transRet.getSecond().plus(discR);
404
405    // Compute cross covariance of the state and the measurements
406    Matrix<States, R> Pxy = new Matrix<>(m_states, rows);
407    for (int i = 0; i < m_pts.getNumSigmas(); i++) {
408      // Pxy += (sigmas_f[:, i] - x̂)(sigmas_h[:, i] - ŷ)ᵀ W_c[i]
409      var dx = residualFuncX.apply(m_sigmasF.extractColumnVector(i), m_xHat);
410      var dy = residualFuncY.apply(sigmasH.extractColumnVector(i), yHat).transpose();
411
412      Pxy = Pxy.plus(dx.times(dy).times(m_pts.getWc(i)));
413    }
414
415    // K = P_{xy} P_y⁻¹
416    // Kᵀ = P_yᵀ⁻¹ P_{xy}ᵀ
417    // P_yᵀKᵀ = P_{xy}ᵀ
418    // Kᵀ = P_yᵀ.solve(P_{xy}ᵀ)
419    // K = (P_yᵀ.solve(P_{xy}ᵀ)ᵀ
420    Matrix<States, R> K = new Matrix<>(Py.transpose().solve(Pxy.transpose()).transpose());
421
422    // x̂ₖ₊₁⁺ = x̂ₖ₊₁⁻ + K(y − ŷ)
423    m_xHat = addFuncX.apply(m_xHat, K.times(residualFuncY.apply(y, yHat)));
424
425    // Pₖ₊₁⁺ = Pₖ₊₁⁻ − KP_yKᵀ
426    m_P = m_P.minus(K.times(Py).times(K.transpose()));
427  }
428}
